server
Class ServerThread

java.lang.Object
  server.ServerThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ServerThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

Handles each client in a non-blocking fashion, reading input and responding appropriately. ServerThread has two modes of operation, the default uses MessageProtocol, sending and receiving ClientMessage and ServerMessage. In the event that an ObjectStream cannot be established, the system falls back on basic text streams. This makes connecting to and using the server via telnet possible.

Author:
Michael Tremel (mtremel@email.arizona.edu)

Constructor Detail

ServerThread

public ServerThread(Server server,
                    java.net.Socket socket)
Sole constructor for this class. Takes server for reference and a connecting client on socket. After the welcome message is sent to the user. At this point, the mode of communication is established (either via MessageProtocol or text streams) and the thread enters its run loop.

Parameters:
server - Server parent of this thread, useful for getting a list of other, connected clients
socket - Socket on which the client is connecting through
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

terminateConnection

public void terminateConnection()
Terminates the connection. This terminates the appropriate Input- and OutputStreams and the Socket itself.

getState

public State getState()
Returns:
the State of a client. e.g., if a client is still running, then State.OK, or if the user has quit, State.DONE/

setState

public void setState(State state)
Sets the state of the thread.

Parameters:
state - new state for this thread

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(ClientMessage message)
Sends a message to the client. This is the default (and only accessible) method of communicating with the client. That means that it will automatically choose the correct OutputStream for the current mode of operation, either via MessageProtocol or text.

Parameters:
message - this message will be sent to the client, but when running in text mode, only the ClientMessage's payload will be sent.

sendMessage

private void sendMessage(java.lang.String message)
Convenience method to send a string to the client when running in text mode. This method should not be used; it is instead preferred that ClientMessage be sent.

Parameters:
message - string will be sent to the client running in text mode
See Also:
sendMessage(ClientMessage)

isTextMode

private boolean isTextMode()
Returns:
true if the client is running using text mode, or false
